poem:
Title: In the Shadow of Conflict

Under the same sun's glare,
Gaza's dust coats loss and savagery.
In tiny hands, the weight of inheritance,
Bearing the relics of fathers, uncles, martyrs.
The airstrike's howl, a premature lullaby 
For sons and grandsons, whispered away.
Haniyeh's grief echoes from Doha,
Through Al Jazeera's solemn mouth-piece.
For the fruits of the human tree,
War - the cruel, unchosen harvest.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
